item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Get King Candy Shield
item.description:
Monopoly GO is always adding exciting seasonal collectibles to keep the game fresh, and the Bon Appétit sticker album is no exception. Among its many themed rewards, the King Candy Shield stands out as one of the sweetest prizes players can earn. With its candy-inspired design, it not only protects your board during Shutdowns but also shows off your progress in the latest album season. Read on to learn how you can get the King Candy Land Shield in Monopoly GO .

How to Get the King Candy Shield in Monopoly GO

The King Candy Shield features a cheerful candy king, wearing a striped candy-cane style crown topped with whipped cream and a cherry. He’s smiling while holding up a large ice cream cone, emphasizing the sweet, dessert-inspired look,

You can get the King Candy Shield by completing Set 18 – Candy Land in the Bon Appétit album. Like all sets, it requires you to collect nine unique stickers, which range in rarity from common to Gold Stickers in Monopoly GO . Once you complete the set, the shield will be permanently added to your collection, and you can equip it whenever you want.

All Stickers in Set # 18 - Candy Land

Here’s a quick look at all the stickers in Set 18 – Candy Land in the Bon Appétit album.

Sticker Name

Rarity

Candy Castle

Three-star sticker

King Candy

Four-star sticker

Princess Lolly

Four-star sticker

Queen Frestine

Four-star Gold sticker

Mr Mint

Five-star sticker

Candied Apple Tree

Five-star sticker

Lord Licorice

Five-star Gold sticker

Peanut Acres

Five-star Gold sticker

Candy Kids

Six-star Gold sticker

Best Ways to Collect Rare Stickers in Monopoly GO

To finish the Candy Land set, you’ll need a steady supply of sticker packs. These can be earned by hitting milestones in solo events, placing on leaderboards, completing Quick Wins, and collecting daily gifts. Rare sticker packs (like Blue, Purple, and Red) give you the best shot at higher-tier (4, 5, 6-stars) and gold stickers.

Since these packs aren’t easy to come by, knowing where to earn them is key. Each week, you can secure at least one guaranteed Purple Pack by finishing your Quick Wins , and you can also earn Red Packs by maxing out your Community Chests . Depending on your progress, you may even unlock multiple Red Packs in a single week.

Keep in mind that Gold Stickers can only be traded during Golden Blitz events, which will definitely become more frequent towards the end of the album season. If you get any Wild Stickers in the meantime, use them to unlock the rare golds in this set.

item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Get Queen Frostine Token
item.description:
With the launch of the Bon Appétit album in Monopoly GO , Scopely has packed the game with new food-themed events and collectibles. One of the first collectibles of this season is the Queen Frostine Token , inspired by the iconic Candy Land queen. Queen Frostine is designed in her regal blue gown, sparkling crown, and snowy-white accents. She brings the wintery charm of Candy Land to your board, making this token a must-have for fans of the classic game and collectors alike. Read on to learn how you can get the Queen Frostine Token in Monopoly GO .

How to Get the Queen Frostine Token in Monopoly GO

The Queen Frostine Token captures her signature elegance, with icy details and a magical pose that fits right into the Candy Land theme. You can get the Queen Frostine Token by completing milestones in the upcoming Candy Land Treasures minigame in Monopoly GO .

This limited-time event works much like other Monopoly GO dig events, where you’ll be using special event tokens to clear tiles on a grid. Each cleared milestone brings you closer to bigger prizes, with Queen Frostine sitting at one of the higher tiers as a featured reward.

The Queen Frostine Token won’t just be a pretty collectible; it’s also exclusive to this event, meaning you won’t be able to get her once Candy Land Treasures ends. If you want to add this token to your shelf, make sure you play strategically during the event’s run, hit the milestone in time, and take advantage of any flash boosters when they appear.

As with all Monopoly GO events, Scopely can change the rewards and requirements at any time. We’ll update this guide with more details when confirmed.

Best Strategy For the Candy Land Treasures Minigame

The Candy Land Treasures minigame in Monopoly GO is one of the most exciting dig-style events, but it can also be one of the most resource-heavy. If you want to claim top rewards like the Queen Frostine Token, you’ll need to be strategic with how you spend your event tokens.

First, resist the urge to clear tiles randomly. Instead, use the treasure silhouettes at the top of the screen to locate the biggest pieces first, focusing on edges and corners to save tokens. Don’t forget that some levels hide critters that automatically clear multiple tiles when uncovered.

Secondly, stockpile as many tokens as possible before digging, since you’ll need a large supply to clear later levels. You can earn these tokens through solo events, tournaments, Quick Wins, and free shop gifts. With proper planning and smart digging, you’ll have the best chance of completing the Candy Land Treasures minigame.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: Well of Souls Location (Lightless Passage)
item.description:
The Well of Souls is a hidden location in Path of Exile 2 required to reveal Desecrated modifiers, a special hidden stat on certain items. Without it, there is no way to put these hidden modifiers into effect.

Fortunately, the Well of Souls becomes available very early on in the campaign of PoE 2 , making it possible for low level characters to access it easily. Here is where it is located.

Where to Find the Well of Souls in Path of Exile 2

Lightless Passage Location

The Well of Souls can be found in the Lightless Passage in Act 2 of Path of Exile 2 , which is located in the Mastodon Badlands . To find the entrance, explore the edges of the Mastodon Badlands map until you see a small dirt path leading down to the Lightless Passage (pictured above).

Enter the Lightless Passage and venture through the area to look for the entrance to the Well of Souls. Inside, you’ll find the Lurking Creature with a golden quest marker above its head.

Interact with it and The Hooded One will arrive to gift you the language of the ancients, allowing you to understand what it’s saying and unlocking the ability to use the Well of Souls.

After you unlock its Waypoint, the Well of Souls will appear on the side of your World Map screen as a fast-travel location, just like Ascendancy Trials and hideouts.

How To Reveal Desecrated Modifiers in Path of Exile 2

How to Use the Well of Souls

Visit the Well of Souls and place a Desecrated item inside the receptacle. Click “Reveal” and you’ll see three different modifiers you can choose from. Pick the one you like best and hit "Confirm."

The selected modifier will be added to your item.

Only Rare tier items can be Desecrated, except when using the Omen of Putrefaction.

Desecrated Modifiers can be added to items by using Abyssal Bones like the Gnawed Jawbone. There are three different tiers of Abyssal Bones: Gnawed, Preserved, and Ancient, all of which can be found by doing Abyssal content in PoE 2 .

Once a Desecrated modifier has been added, it will only appear as a line of green-colored gibberish . To reveal it, you’ll need to visit the Well of Souls. The outcome of this craft can be influenced by Omens.

Crafting currency like Vaal Orbs, Chaos Orbs, and Divine Orbs can still be used on an item with a Desecrated modifier.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Current Banner, Next Banner, And Past Banners
item.description:
The banners in Zenless Zone Zero are called Signal Search, and it's split into four parts; Exclusive Channel, W-Engine Channel, Stable Channel (Star-Studded Cast), and Bangboo Channel. Exclusive Channel is the banner that features a limited S-Rank Agent, while the W-Engine is where players can get the signature weapon for the featured 5-star character. Meanwhile, Stable Channel and Bangboo Channel are standard banners in ZZZ , where the former contains S-Rank Agents and W-Engines, whereas the latter is exclusively for 4-star and 5-star Bangboos.

Players can get standard banner characters from the limited banner if they lose their 50/50 chance, so there are multiple ways to get Stable Channel characters. Proxies can also pick a character of their choice if they pull a total of 300 Signal Search in the Star-Studded Cast. Since the standard banners don't change, players may be interested in knowing the current, next, and past banners in the ZZZ limited banner instead. For that, you can check out this article for everything you want to know about Zenless Zone Zero limited Signal Search.

ZZZ Current Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

The current banner in ZZZ is as such:

Version 2.1: August 6, 2025 – September 2, 2025 (Phase 2)

Alice Debut

Practiced Perfection

Yanagi Rerun

Timeweaver

ZZZ Next Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

Here's the known next banner for ZZZ :

Version 2.2: September 3, 2025 – September 24, 2025 (Phase 1)

Seed Debut

Trigger Rerun

Version 2.2: September 24, 2025 – October 14, 2025 (Phase 2)

Orphie & Magus Debut

Evelyn Rerun

ZZZ Upcoming Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

Zenless Zone Zero 2.3 upcoming banners all come from the Spook Shack faction, Yidhari, Lucia, and Manato.

item.title: Most Overpowered Digimon Ever
item.description:
Summary

  • Some Digi-evolutions are cataclysmic: ZeedMillenniummon and Apocalymon can erase worlds.
  • Royal Knights and Jogress fusions (Examon, Alphamon Ooryuken, Gallantmon X) wield near-unstoppable might.
  • Godlike Digimon are rare, feared, and playable only in select titles like DMO or Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth.

In terms of raw power, some Digi Evolutions or Jogress (DNA Evolutions) are just so OP that the balance of the Digital World shifts forever depending on their actions. These Digimon are so powerful that they are rarely seen alongside a Tamer or Chosen One, and are considered seats of power or part of a legend. In some cases, their core function is to bring about the end of the Digital (and sometimes real) World.

These massive Digital Monsters have long been considered for long the most notorious, not only for their broken abilities, but also their power levels, size, and the complexity of the processes that drive their Digievolutions. Here are the most overpowered Digimon players will meet in the games.

ZeedMilleniummon

The Definitive Final Boss

  • Power Rank: SSS
  • Type: VIRUS
  • Phase: Mega

This massive Digimon of the size of a planet, roams the space of the Digital World, destroying worlds all around, and warping between time and dimensions thanks to its godlike powers. If Apocalymon is the destroyer of the Digital World by nature, then ZeedMilleniummon is the destroyer of the universe. His Time Destroyer ultimate move is so powerful that it basically warps time itself, turning any Digimon that faces it into a scramble of Data devoid of life.

And that's not even a fraction of its power, since this beast can snuff out a whole galaxy in a fraction of a second. However, its cruelty towards all living things makes it arrogant and confident enough to let some 'heroes' defy it in single combat. Perhaps, that's the only weakness this creature has, since it can be stopped, but it cannot be completely destroyed, since it will return to a 'Chained' dormant state, warping through Dark Matter until it recovers millennia later. What's most scary about Zeed Millenniumon is that this is only its Mega form, and rumor says (besides its Moon form) it has a Burst Mode that is infinitely more powerful.

Examon

Ruler Of All Dragons, Knight Savior

  • Power Rank: SS++
  • Type: DATA
  • Phase: Jogress

The fusion of Slayerdramon and Breakdramon, two Mega Digimon from the Dracomon line, results in the massive and virtuous Examon: The Spear Dragon Knight. Examon is the most powerful Data Digimon of them all, with massive size and raw firepower thanks to a combination of Holy and Draconic abilities. He occupies a privileged seat among the Royal Knights as the strongest Digimon of this group of Digital World

Justicars, and also as the Emperor Dragon, the most powerful Digimon of that family.

Examon's Spear (Ambrose) rivals the power of Gram and Gugnir, and the scales of this Digimon are made of a special alloy of Red Digizoid named Chronodigizoid, the most powerful metal in the Digital World. Its wings are as strong as shields, and it has three main attacks: Avalon Gate, Pendragon's Glory, and Draconic Impact. Examon is inspired by Uther Pendragon, father of King Arthur, who was also called the Dragon Emperor in one of the origins of this mythological character.

Chaosmon

The Empowered Version Of a Fan Favorite

  • Power Rank: SS++
  • Type: VACCINE
  • Phase: Jogress

When the pinnacle of the Leomon line (BanchoLeomon) and Darkdramon go through Jogress Digi-Evolution, Chaosmon is born. A DNA digimon that retains the pride and honor of Leomon, alongside its unique blade, but also the chaotic and destructive nature of Darkdramon. This Digimon is powerful because it preserves its two DigiCores intact (like Omnimon, Apocalymon, and a few others), but its raw firepower is far greater than many Jogress Digimon, with the sole exception of Examon.

Its signature attack is Bancho Blade, which supercharges Leomon's Magna Shishomaru (Great Beast King Blade) with the powerf of chaos and launches a powerful attack, slicing everything on its path. Then it has another attack called Dark Prominence, which unleashes the full power of Darkdramon's line and penetrates the defense of his enemies, reaching their core and destabilizing it, turning its victims into shattered pieces of crystal. Quite a fearsome opponent to face in the Digital World.

Fanglongmon

The Fusion Of Four Divine Digimon

  • Power Rank: SS+
  • Type: DATA
  • Phase: Jogress

Fanglongmon is the biggest and deadliest Cross Digievolutions (Jogress of four Digimon), which results of a combination of the Four Divine Beast Digimon: Azulongmon, Byakkomon, Ebonwumon, and Zhuqiaomon). This Divine Dragon Emperor is said to have ruled the world before the Great Archangels (led by an unnamed proto form of Magna Angemon, Ophanimon, and Rasielmon) descended and sealed this Digimon in the profundity of the Digital World, by dividing its essence and dispersing it in the four cardinal points.

When Azulongmon finally gathered the rest of the Divine Beasts, Fanglongmon descended upon the Digital World once more, there are two games where players can wield its immense power. The first one is Digimon Masters Online, and most recently, in Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth. Be it as it may, this powerful Digimon can completely obliterate the Digital World, but thankfully, it's not a mindless destructive beast like some Virus-type Digimon.

Alphamon Ooryuken

One Of The Most Powerful Royal Knights

  • Power Rank: SS
  • Type: VACCINE
  • Phase: Jogress

When Alphamon and Oryumon combine, the latter turns into the legendary Oryu Sword (or Ultimate Battle Sword) capable of cutting through the data of any Digimon in the Digital World, no matter how strong their protections are. Alphamon Ooryuken is the result of Jogress Evolution, and is one of the strongest members of the group of Digimon known as Royal Knights. In the canon, there's only one Alphamon Oryuken, who occupies the seat of power of its predecessor Alphamon, after undergoing Cross Evolution with Oryumon.

In the games, players can wield the power of this massive Dark Knight (especially those who play DMO) and use its powerful technique called Ultimate Blade, to cut through everything. Alphamon Ooryuken has made appearances in various mangas and seasons of the Anime, and every time he enters battle, he leaves a powerful impression on every witness of his incredible abilities.

Gallantmon X

The Most Powerful Version Of Dukemon

  • Power Rank: S++
  • Type: VIRUS
  • Phase: Burst Mode (Special)

Together with Magnamon, Examon, Omnimon, and many others, Gallantmon X is one of the group of Digimon known as Royal Knights, legendary protectors of the Digital World. This particular version of Gallantmon (or Dukemon) has been integrated with the Antibody X, granting his shield supreme durability, and shattering his Digizoid Spear into a bursting spike of deadly plasma.

The armor of this Digimon is made of Chronodigizoid, an amalgam of the purest and hardest metals in the Digital World, so it's practically impenetrable. Gallantmon X is not only the epitome of defense, but his Lightning Joust move uses Gallantmon's spear (Gram) to penetrate anything and vaporize any evil Digimon that defies the commands of his liege. The most powerful version of this Gallantmon can be found in Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth, and it is one of the hardest to unlock.

Imperialdramon Paladin Mode

If King Arthur Was A Digimon, It Would Be This One

  • Power Rank: S+
  • Type: VACCINE
  • Phase: Burst Mode

Everyone knows the classic Imperialdramon Fighter Mode from the Digimon Adventure 2 series, but few are aware of its Burst Mode known as Imperialdramon Paladin mode, a powerful Digimon that has gone beyond the Mega level, thanks to the influence of his pride and valiant heart. Imperialdramon PM is inspired by King Arthur, and is also a proud member of the Royal Knights, and he wields an inheritance of the great Omnimon (fallen in battle), the Omega Blade.

This powerful weapon serves as a legacy and source of power inherited from the legendary Holy Knight, and grants Imperialdramon Paladin Mode extreme battle acumen, speed, and the ability to use the Holy attribute to vanquish evil. Fans have the curious theory that a corrupted version of Imperialdramon Paladin Mode exists, which theoretically would have inherited the Dark Omni Blade from Omnimon Zwart (Black Omnimon), and if logic serves as a guide, it might be inspired by Mordred. Though this beast has not been revealed yet in any game or anime, and the closest thing players can find in a game is Imperialdramon Fighter Mode (Black), which is a corrupted version of the original Imperialdramon FM from the Virus Dark-attribute.

Apocalymon

The Destroyer of the Digital World

  • Power Rank: S+
  • Type: VIRUS
  • Phase: Jogress

Apocalymon is the definitive antagonist of the Digital World, and a being that is born of the fusion of the Four Dark Masters (Piedmon, Puppetmon, Machinedramon, and MetalSeadramon). This being of absolute destruction hides its true shape inside an impenetrable dodecahedron made of corrupted Black Digizoid. It attacks using the accumulated energies from the corrupted Data it destroys and stores inside its mobile fortress, though its true form is that of a malignant creature that poses as a humanoid atop one of the faces of its armor-like body.

This Virus Digimon can use a powerful world-ending move named Darkness-Zone, which is often cast inside a vacuum created with a barrier, to limit its power and eliminate single targets that oppose this tyrannical Digimon. Apocalymon played the role of the final Boss in many Digimon games (and in the S2 of Digimon Adventure), but curiously, the only chance to have this Digimon as a Partner happens in DMO, and it has already been discontinued, so there's no way to get it today.
